definition: to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
a type of standing harp, smaller than konghou 箜篌, with 5-25 strings
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: Huddled in the house, feeling colder than the winter.
sentences.chinese: 我瑟缩在屋子里，感觉比冬天更冷。

sentences.english: We were shivering at the merciless northerly winds up on the very peak of the Phoenix Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 在凤凰山的顶上，我们瑟缩于无情的北风之中。

sentences.english: The child recoiled from the door, and it closed upon her.
sentences.chinese: 孩子瑟缩地退了出来，门立即关上了。

sentences.english: He remembered her trembling uncertainty in his arms, her shocked cries of pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 他想起了她瑟缩在他的怀里，她快乐叫着哆嗦着。

sentences.english: He appeared numbed and uneasy there.
sentences.chinese: 他在那里显得瑟缩不安。

sentences.english: A explode of cool breeze is beat, the rich brocade blow a sneeze, the body Se shrunk bottom.
sentences.chinese: 一阵凉风吹来，锦绣打了个喷嚏，身子瑟缩了下。

sentences.english: The breeze along the window came, I hold in my hand the leaves in the huddle.
sentences.chinese: 轻风沿着窗口袭来，我手上拿着的叶子在瑟缩的颤动。

sentences.english: And birds sit brooding in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿们在雪裡瑟缩栖息著。

sentences.english: Then the little pink flowers smile, though they have turned a mournful crimson with cold and are shivering still.
sentences.chinese: 她于是一笑，虽然颜色冻得红惨惨地，仍然瑟缩着。

sentences.english: Although her petals turned a mournful crimson because of coldness, she smiled, still shivering.
sentences.chinese: 她于是一笑，虽然颜色冻得红惨惨地，仍然瑟缩着。

definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
